column4: anyone want to explain drivers to me? I also saw them as independent software that played mediator between the computer and the new hardware, but in linux I don't see a easy install for drivers.
the short answer is that all known drivers are already in the kernel, you don't have to install drivers. And the ones that aren't aren't easy to install
so if it doesn't plug and play....im out of luck
not entirely, but in general. What do you need a driver for? (and please don't say winmodem :)

netgear

that lsmod command? it shows all the modules that the kernel has loaded, a lot of those are drivers for hardware you have.
